HF?$JL2KJ
&lt;p style=font: bold 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;Note 1 &amp;#8211; Organization and Nature of&#13;Business&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;Effective January 21, 2021, we changed our name&#13;from Black Ridge Oil &amp;#38; Gas, Inc. to Sow Good Inc. (&amp;#8220;SOWG,&amp;#8221; &amp;#8220;Sow Good,&amp;#8221; or the &amp;#8220;Company&amp;#8221;). Our&#13;common stock is traded on the OTCQB under the trading symbol &amp;#8220;SOWG&amp;#8221;. &lt;font style=color: black; background-color: white&gt;At&#13;that time, o&lt;/font&gt;ur common stock started to be quoted on the OTCQB under the trading symbol &amp;#8220;SOWG&amp;#8221;, from the former trading&#13;symbol &amp;#8220;ANFC&amp;#8221;. Prior to April 2, 2012, the Company name was Ante5, Inc., which became an independent company in April 2010.&#13;We became a publicly traded company when our shares began trading on July 1, 2010. From October 2010 through August 2019, we had&#13;been engaged in the business of acquiring oil and gas leases and participating in the drilling of wells in the Bakken and Three Forks&#13;trends in North Dakota and Montana and /or managing similar assets for third parties.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;On September 26, 2017, the Company finalized an&#13;equity raise utilizing a rights offering and backstop agreement, raising net proceeds of $5,051,675 and issuing 1,439,400 shares. The&#13;proceeds were used to sponsor a special purpose acquisition company, discussed below, with the remainder for general corporate purposes.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=background-color: white&gt;On October&#13;10, 2017, the Company&amp;#8217;s sponsored special purpose acquisition company, Black Ridge Acquisition Corp. (&amp;#8220;BRAC&amp;#8221;), completed&#13;an IPO raising $138,000,000 of gross proceeds (including proceeds from the exercise of an over-allotment option by the underwriters on&#13;October 18, 2017). In addition, the Company purchased 445,000 BRAC units at $10.00 per unit in a private placement transaction for a total&#13;contribution of $4,450,000 in order to fulfill its obligations in sponsoring BRAC, &lt;/font&gt;a blank check company formed for the purpose&#13;of entering into a merger, share exchange, asset acquisition, stock purchase, recapitalization, reorganization or other similar business&#13;combination with one or more businesses or entities. BRAC&amp;#8217;s efforts to identify a prospective target business were not limited to&#13;a particular industry or geographic region. Following the IPO and over-allotment, BROG owned 22% of the outstanding common stock of BRAC&#13;and managed BRAC&amp;#8217;s operations via a management services agreement. On December 19, 2018, BRAC entered into a business combination&#13;agreement, which subsequently closed on August&amp;#160;9, 2019.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify; background-color: white&gt;On October 1, 2020, the&#13;Company completed its acquisition of S-FDF, LLC pursuant to an Asset Purchase Agreement. In connection with the closing of the Asset Purchase&#13;Agreement, the Company acquired approximately $2.2&amp;#160;million in cash and certain assets and agreements related to the Seller&amp;#8217;s&#13;freeze-dried fruits and vegetables business for human consumption and entered into certain employment and registration rights agreements.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Note&#13;2&lt;/b&gt; &amp;#8211; &lt;b&gt;Summary of Significant Accounting Policies&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: normal 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;u&gt;Basis&#13;of Accounting&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The&#13;accompanying financial statements have been prepared in conformity with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States&#13;of America and the rules of the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC). All references to Generally Accepted Accounting Principles&#13;(&amp;#8220;GAAP&amp;#8221;) are in accordance with The FASB Accounting Standards Codification (&amp;#8220;ASC&amp;#8221;) and the Hierarchy of Generally&#13;Accepted Accounting Principles.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;u&gt;Reclassifications&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;In&#13;the prior year, the income, expense and cash flows from Black Ridge Acquisition Corp., a wholly-owned subsidiary formed on October 10,&#13;2017, which was consolidated as a variable interest entity through August 9, 2019, the date that BRAC completed a business combination&#13;with Allied Esports Entertainment, Inc. (&amp;#8220;AESE&amp;#8221;), were consolidated and have been retrospectively classified as discontinued&#13;operations. In addition, prior period investment in Allied Esports Entertainment, Inc. securities of $6,982,300 were reclassified from&#13;long term assets to current assets to conform to management&amp;#8217;s intent and ability to liquidate the asset.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;u&gt;Segment&#13;Reporting&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;FASB&#13;ASC 280-10-50 requires annual and interim reporting for an enterprise&amp;#8217;s operating segments and related disclosures about its products,&#13;services, geographic areas and major customers. An operating segment is defined as a component of an enterprise that engages in business&#13;activities from which it may earn revenues and expenses, and about which separate financial information is regularly evaluated by the&#13;chief operating decision maker in deciding how to allocate resources. The Company operates as a single segment and will evaluate additional&#13;segment disclosure requirements as it expands its operations.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.15in; text-align: justify; text-indent: -0.15in&gt;&lt;font style=font: normal 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;u&gt;Use&#13;of Estimates&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The&#13;preparation of financial statements in conformity with generally accepted accounting principles requires management to make estimates&#13;and assumptions that affect the reported amounts of assets and liabilities and disclosure of contingent assets and liabilities at the&#13;date of the financial statements and the reported amount of revenues and expenses during the reporting period. Actual results could differ&#13;from those estimates.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;u&gt;Environmental&#13;Liabilities&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The&#13;Company was formerly a direct owner of assets in the oil and gas industry. The oil and gas industry is subject, by its nature, to environmental&#13;hazards and clean-up costs. At this time, management knows of no substantial losses from environmental accidents or events which would&#13;have a material effect on the Company.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;u&gt;Cash&#13;and Cash Equivalents&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Cash&#13;equivalents include money market accounts which have maturities of three months or less. For the purpose of the statements of cash flows,&#13;all highly liquid investments with an original maturity of three months or less are considered to be cash equivalents. Cash equivalents&#13;are stated at cost plus accrued interest, which approximates market value. There were no cash equivalents on hand at December&amp;#160;31,&#13;2020 and 2019.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;u&gt;Cash&#13;in Excess of FDIC Insured Limits&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The&#13;Company maintains its cash in bank deposit accounts which, at times, may exceed federally insured limits. Accounts are guaranteed by&#13;the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation (FDIC) and the Securities Investor Protection Corporation (SIPC) up to $250,000 and $500,000,&#13;respectively, under current regulations. The Company had approximately $1,311,464 and $-0- in excess of FDIC and SIPC insured limits&#13;at December 31, 2020 and 2019, respectively. The Company has not experienced any losses in such accounts.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;u&gt;Fair&#13;Value of Financial Instruments&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Under&#13;FASB ASC 820-10-05, the Financial Accounting Standards Board establishes a framework for measuring fair value in generally accepted accounting&#13;principles and expands disclosures about fair value measurements. This Statement reaffirms that fair value is the relevant measurement&#13;attribute. The adoption of this standard did not have a material effect on the Company&amp;#8217;s financial statements as reflected herein.&#13;The carrying amounts of cash, accounts payable and accrued expenses reported on the balance sheets are estimated by management to approximate&#13;fair value primarily due to the short-term nature of the instruments. &lt;font style=color: black&gt;The Company had no items that required&#13;fair value measurement on a recurring basis.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;u&gt;Property&#13;and Equipment&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Property&#13;and equipment are stated at the lower of cost or estimated net recoverable amount. The cost of property, plant and equipment is depreciated&#13;using the straight-line method based on the lesser of the estimated useful lives of the assets or the lease term based on the following&#13;life expectancy:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 align=center style=width: 80%; border-collapse: collapse; font-size: 10pt&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style=vertical-align: top&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 38%; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Software&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 42%; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;3 years, or over&#13;    the life of the agreement&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style=vertical-align: top; background-color: #CCFFCC&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Office equipment&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;5 years&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style=vertical-align: top&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Furniture and fixtures&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;5 years&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style=vertical-align: top; background-color: #CCFFCC&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Machinery and equipment&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;7-10 years&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style=vertical-align: top&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Intangible assets&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Indefinite&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style=vertical-align: top; background-color: #CCFFCC&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Leasehold improvements&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Fully extended lease-term&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Repairs&#13;and maintenance expenditures are charged to operations as incurred. Major improvements and replacements, which extend the useful life&#13;of an asset, are capitalized and depreciated over the remaining estimated useful life of the asset. When assets are retired or sold,&#13;the cost and related accumulated depreciation and amortization are eliminated and any resulting gain or loss is reflected in operations.&#13;Depreciation expense was $3,642 and $872 for the years ended December&amp;#160;31,&amp;#160;2020 and&amp;#160;2019, respectively.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.15in; text-align: justify; text-indent: -0.15in&gt;&lt;font style=font: normal 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;u&gt;Impairment&#13;of Long-Lived Assets&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Long-lived&#13;assets held and used by the Company are reviewed for possible impairment whenever events or circumstances indicate the carrying amount&#13;of an asset may not be recoverable or is impaired. Recoverability is assessed using undiscounted cash flows based upon historical results&#13;and current projections of earnings before interest and taxes. Impairment is measured using discounted cash flows of future operating&#13;results based upon a rate that corresponds to the cost of capital. Impairments are recognized in operating results to the extent that&#13;carrying value exceeds discounted cash flows of future operations.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify; background-color: white&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Our&#13;intellectual property is comprised of indefinite-lived brand names acquired and have been assigned an indefinite life as we currently&#13;anticipate that these brand names will contribute cash flows to the Company perpetually. We evaluate the recoverability of intangible&#13;assets periodically by taking into account events or circumstances that may warrant revised estimates of useful lives or that indicate&#13;the asset may be impaired.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;u&gt;Inventory&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Inventory,&#13;consisting of raw materials, material overhead, labor, and manufacturing overhead, are stated at the lower of cost (first-in, first-out)&#13;or net realizable value and consist of the following:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=border-collapse: collapse; width: 100%&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan=2 style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; text-align: center&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;December&#13;    31,&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Times
 Serif&gt;Raw&#13;    materials&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 2.5pt double; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 2.5pt double; font-size: 10pt; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;141,371&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 2.5pt double; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 2.5pt double; font-size: 10pt; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#8211;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;/table&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;No&#13;reserve for obsolete inventories has been recognized, and we have not yet commenced production.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;u&gt;Goodwill&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The&#13;Company evaluates goodwill on an annual basis in the fourth quarter or more frequently if management believes indicators of impairment&#13;exist. Such indicators could include, but are not limited to (1) a significant adverse change in legal factors or in business climate,&#13;(2) unanticipated competition, or (3) an adverse action or assessment by a regulator. The Company first assesses qualitative factors&#13;to determine whether it is more likely than not that the fair value of a reporting unit is less than its carrying amount, management&#13;conducts a quantitative goodwill impairment test. The impairment test involves comparing the fair value of the applicable reporting unit&#13;with its carrying value. The Company estimates the fair values of its reporting units using a combination of the income, or discounted&#13;cash flows, approach and the market approach, which utilizes comparable companies&amp;#8217; data. If the carrying amount of a reporting&#13;unit exceeds the reporting unit&amp;#8217;s fair value, an impairment loss is recognized in an amount equal to that excess, limited to the&#13;total amount of goodwill allocated to that reporting unit. The Company&amp;#8217;s evaluation of goodwill completed during the year resulted&#13;in no impairment losses.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;u&gt;Revenue&#13;Recognition&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The&#13;Company will recognize revenue in accordance with ASC 606 &amp;#8212; Revenue from Contracts with Customers. Under ASC 606, the Company will&#13;recognize revenue from the sale of its freeze-dried food products once operations commence, &lt;font style=color: black; background-color: white&gt;in&#13;accordance with a five-step model in which the Company will evaluate the transfer of promised goods or services and recognize revenue&#13;when customers obtain control of promised goods or services in an amount that reflects the consideration which the Company expects to&#13;be entitled to receive in exchange for those goods or services. To determine revenue recognition for the arrangements that the Company&#13;determines are within the scope of ASC 606, the Company will perform the following five steps: (1)&amp;#160;identify the contract(s) with&#13;a customer, (2)&amp;#160;identify the performance obligations in the contract, (3)&amp;#160;determine the transaction price, (4)&amp;#160;allocate&#13;the transaction price to the performance obligations in the contract and (5)&amp;#160;recognize revenue when (or as) the entity satisfies&#13;a performance obligation. The Company has elected, as a practical expedient, to account for the shipping and handling as fulfillment&#13;costs, rather than as a separate performance obligation. Revenue will be reported net of applicable provisions for discounts, returns&#13;and allowances. Methodologies for determining these provisions will be dependent on customer pricing and promotional practices. The Company&#13;will record reductions to revenue for estimated product returns and pricing adjustments in the same period that the related revenue is&#13;recorded. These estimates will be based on industry-based historical data, historical sales returns, if any, analysis of credit memo&#13;data, and other factors known at the time. &lt;/font&gt;The Company recognized management fee income as services were provided in 2019.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;u&gt;Revenue&#13;Concentration&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;All&#13;of the Company&amp;#8217;s revenue earned came from management fees earned through its management services agreement with BRAC, which ceased&#13;as of December 31, 2019.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;u&gt;Basic&#13;and Diluted Earnings (Loss) Per Share&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Basic&#13;earnings (loss) per share (&amp;#8220;EPS&amp;#8221;) are computed by dividing net income (the numerator) by the weighted average number of common&#13;shares outstanding for the period (the denominator). Diluted EPS is computed by dividing net income by the weighted average number of&#13;common shares and potential common shares outstanding (if dilutive) during each period. Potential common shares include stock options,&#13;warrants and restricted stock. The number of potential common shares outstanding relating to stock options, warrants and restricted stock&#13;is computed using the treasury stock method.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The&#13;reconciliation of the denominators used to calculate basic EPS and diluted EPS for the years ended December&amp;#160;31,&amp;#160;2020 and 2019&#13;are as follows:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times

 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 2.5pt double; font-size: 10pt; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;1,600,417&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;/table&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;For&#13;2020 and 2019, potential dilutive securities had an anti-dilutive effect and were not included in the calculation of diluted net loss&#13;per common share. Stock options and warrants excluded from the calculation of diluted EPS because their effect was anti-dilutive were&#13;565,824 and 34,204 of December&amp;#160;31,&amp;#160;2020 and 2019, respectively.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify; background-color: white&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;u&gt;Stock-Based&#13;Compensation&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Under&#13;FASB ASC 718-10-30-2, all share-based payments to employees, including grants of employee stock options, are to be recognized in the&#13;income statement based on their fair values. Pro forma disclosure is no longer an alternative. The Company recognized $268,608 of stock-based&#13;compensation for the issuance of shares of common stock for services in 2020. Amortization of the fair values of stock options issued&#13;for services and compensation totaled $458,048 and $100,526 for the years ended December&amp;#160;31,&amp;#160;2020 and 2019, respectively. The&#13;fair values of stock options were determined using the Black-Scholes options pricing model and an effective term of 6 to 6.5 years based&#13;on the weighted average of the vesting periods and the stated term of the option grants and the discount rate on 5 to 7 year U.S. Treasury&#13;securities at the grant date and are being amortized over the related implied service term, or vesting period. In addition, $377,440&#13;of expenses related to the amortization of warrants issued in consideration of personal guarantees provided for debt financing, using&#13;the Black-Scholes options pricing model and an effective term of 5 years based on the weighted average of the vesting periods and the&#13;stated term of the warrant grants and the discount rate on 5 year U.S. Treasury securities at the grant date were recognized as interest&#13;expense for the year ended December 31, 2020.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;u&gt;Income&#13;Taxes&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The&#13;Company recognizes deferred tax assets and liabilities based on differences between the financial reporting and tax basis of assets and&#13;liabilities using the enacted tax rates and laws that are expected to be in effect when the differences are expected to be recovered.&#13;The Company provides a valuation allowance for deferred tax assets for which it does not consider realization of such assets to be more&#13;likely than not.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;On&#13;December 22, 2017 the U.S. Tax Cuts and Jobs Act of 2017 (&amp;#8220;Tax Reform&amp;#8221;) was signed into law. As a result of Tax Reform, the&#13;U.S. statutory rate was lowered from 35% to 21% effective January 1, 2018, among other changes. ASC Topic 740 requires companies to recognize&#13;the effect of tax law changes in the period of enactment; therefore, the Company was required to value its deferred tax assets and liabilities&#13;at the new rate. The SEC issued Staff Accounting Bulletin No. 118 (&amp;#8220;SAB 108&amp;#8221;) to address the application of GAAP in situations&#13;when a registrant does not have the necessary information available, prepared or analyzed (including computations) in reasonable detail&#13;to complete the accounting for certain effects of Tax Reform. The ultimate impact may differ from the provisional amount, possibly materially,&#13;as a result of additional analysis, changes in interpretations and assumptions the Company has made, additional regulatory guidance that&#13;may be issued and actions the Company may take as a result of Tax Reform.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;u&gt;Uncertain&#13;Tax Positions&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;In&#13;accordance with ASC 740, &amp;#8220;Income Taxes&amp;#8221; (&amp;#8220;ASC 740&amp;#8221;), the Company recognizes the tax benefit from an uncertain&#13;tax position only if it is more likely than not that the tax position will be capable of withstanding examination by the taxing authorities&#13;based on the technical merits of the position. These standards prescribe a recognition threshold and measurement attribute for the financial&#13;statement recognition and measurement of a tax position taken or expected to be taken in a tax return. These standards also provide guidance&#13;on de-recognition, classification, interest and penalties, accounting in interim periods, disclosure, and transition.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Various&#13;taxing authorities can periodically audit the Company&amp;#8217;s income tax returns. These audits include questions regarding the Company&amp;#8217;s&#13;tax filing positions, including the timing and amount of deductions and the allocation of income to various tax jurisdictions. In evaluating&#13;the exposures connected with these various tax filing positions, including state and local taxes, the Company records allowances for&#13;probable exposures. A number of years may elapse before a particular matter, for which an allowance has been established, is audited&#13;and fully resolved. The Company has not yet undergone an examination by any taxing authorities.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The&#13;assessment of the Company&amp;#8217;s tax position relies on the judgment of management to estimate the exposures associated with the Company&amp;#8217;s&#13;various filing positions.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;u&gt;Recent&#13;Accounting Pronouncements&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify; background-color: white&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;From&#13;time to time, new accounting pronouncements are issued by the Financial Accounting Standards Board (&amp;#34;FASB&amp;#34;) that are adopted&#13;by the Company as of the specified effective date. If not discussed, management believes that the impact of recently issued standards,&#13;which are not yet effective, will not have a material impact on the Company's financial statements upon adoption.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; background-color: white&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;b&gt;Note 3 &amp;#8211; Going Concern&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;As shown in the accompanying financial statements,&#13;as of December 31, 2020, the Company had a cash balance of $1,912,729 and working capital of $1,768,153. The Company has no revenue source&#13;presently. Based on projections of cash expenditures in the Company&amp;#8217;s current business plan, the cash on hand would be insufficient&#13;to sustain operations over the next year. On February 5, 2021, we raised $2.525 million from the sale of an aggregate 631,250 shares of&#13;the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock at $4.00 per share, resulting in approximately $2.7 million of cash on hand and $650,000 of liquid securities&#13;for a combined liquidity of $3.35 million as of March 19, 2021.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;The Company continues to pursue sources of additional&#13;capital through debt and financing transactions or arrangements, including equity financing or other means. We may not be successful in&#13;identifying suitable funding transactions in a sufficient time period or at all, and we may not obtain the capital we require by other&#13;means. If we do not succeed in raising additional capital, our resources may not be sufficient to fund our business. Our ability to scale&#13;production and distribution capabilities and further increase the value of our brands, is largely dependent on our success in raising&#13;additional capital.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Note&#13;4 &amp;#8211; Business Combination, S-FDF&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; background-color: white&gt;On&#13;October 1, 2020, the Company completed its acquisition of S-FDF, LLC (the &amp;#34;Seller&amp;#34;), a Texas limited liability&#13;company, pursuant to an Asset Purchase Agreement, between the Company and the Seller, dated June 9, 2020, as subsequently&#13;amended effective October&amp;#160;1, 2020. In connection with the closing of the Asset Purchase Agreement, the Company acquired&#13;approximately $2.2 million in cash and certain assets and agreements related to the Seller&amp;#8217;s freeze-dried fruits and&#13;vegetables business for human consumption and entered into certain employment and registration rights agreements. The Company&#13;did not assume any liabilities of Seller or any liabilities, liens, or encumbrances pertaining to or encumbering the&#13;Purchased Assets, except for those related to agreements or arrangements specified in the Asset Purchase Agreement. The&#13;Seller transferred the Purchased Assets to the Company in exchange for the issuance of 1,120,000 shares of the&#13;Company&amp;#8217;s common stock to the Seller. The number of Seller Shares to be issued was subject to adjustment, as specified&#13;in the Asset Purchase Agreement, as amended, based on the extent to which the amount of cash proceeds held by the Company, as&#13;derived from the sale of the Company&amp;#8217;s holdings of Allied Esports Entertainment Inc. (&amp;#34;AESE&amp;#34;) Shares, were less&#13;than $5&amp;#160;million or greater than $6&amp;#160;million on the date specified in the Asset Purchase Agreement, which resulted in&#13;the issuance of an additional 500,973 Seller Shares that were issued on January 4, 2021. The combined issuances represented&#13;approximately 46% of the Company&amp;#8217;s issued and outstanding common stock, on a fully diluted basis. Black Ridge Oil &amp;#38;&#13;Gas, Inc. was determined to be the acquiror of the business combination.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; background-color: white&gt;Pursuant&#13;to its obligations under the Asset Purchase Agreement, on the Closing Date the Company, (a) created three new seats on the Company&amp;#8217;s&#13;Board of Directors and appointed the Seller&amp;#8217;s principals, Ira Goldfarb and Claudia Goldfarb, and a third person designated by the&#13;Goldfarbs, Greg Creed, as directors, (b) entered into employment agreements with Ira Goldfarb and Claudia Goldfarb, (c) delivered a registration&#13;rights agreement with respect to the Seller Shares and any shares of common stock delivered as part of the employment compensation for&#13;Ira Goldfarb or Claudia Goldfarb, and (d) amended the Company&amp;#8217;s 2020 Stock Incentive Plan to increase the number of shares of common&#13;stock reserved thereunder. At closing, the Company also assumed the Seller&amp;#8217;s obligations under a real property lease for its facility&#13;in Irving, Texas under which an entity owned entirely by Ira Goldfarb is the landlord.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify; background-color: white&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;This&#13;acquisition was accounted for as a business combination under the purchase method of accounting. The purchase resulted in the recognition&#13;of $6,411,327 of goodwill, which is evaluated annually for impairment, unless circumstances change that require an earlier determination.&#13;According to the purchase method of accounting, the Company recognized the identifiable assets acquired and liabilities assumed as follows:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=border-collapse: collapse; width: 100%&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;October&#13;    1,&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Consideration&#13;    paid in excess of fair value (Goodwill)&lt;/b&gt;&lt;sup&gt;(1)&lt;/sup&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 2.5pt double; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 2.5pt double; font-size: 10pt; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;6,411,327&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;___________&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;(1)&#13;The consideration paid in excess of the net fair value of assets acquired and liabilities assumed was recognized as goodwill. The book&#13;value of the net assets acquired was determined to represent the fair market value, and no additional intangible assets were evidenced.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times

 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;u&gt;Pro&#13;Forma Results&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The&#13;following table sets forth the unaudited pro forma results of the Company as if the acquisition of S-FDF, LLC was effective on the first&#13;day of each of the periods presented. These combined results are not necessarily indicative of the results that may have been achieved&#13;had the companies always been combined.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;3,221,390&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: White&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Net income&#13;    (loss) per common share - basic&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;(1.61&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;1.28&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: rgb(204
