204)&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Net income&#13;    (loss) per common share - fully diluted&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;(1.61&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;1.28&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;/table&gt;&#13;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;b&gt;Note 5 &amp;#8211; BRAC&amp;#8217;s IPO, Consolidation&#13;of BRAC and Non-controlling Interest&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;i&gt;BRAC&amp;#8217;s IPO&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;The registration statement for the BRAC&amp;#8217;s&#13;IPO was declared effective on October 4, 2017. The registration statement was initially declared effective for 10,000,000 units (&amp;#8220;Units&amp;#8221;&#13;and, with respect to the common stock included in the Units being offered, the &amp;#8220;Public Shares&amp;#8221;), but the offering was increased&#13;to 12,000,000 Units pursuant to Rule 462(b) under the Securities Act of 1933, as amended. On October 10, 2017, the Company consummated&#13;the Initial Public Offering of 12,000,000 units, generating gross proceeds of $120,000,000.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;Simultaneous with the closing of the IPO, BRAC&#13;sold 400,000 units (the &amp;#8220;Placement Units&amp;#8221;) at a price of $10.00 per Unit in a private placement to BROG, generating gross&#13;proceeds of $4,000,000. BROG&amp;#8217;s investment in BRAC&amp;#8217;s common stock was eliminated in consolidation prior to the BRAC&amp;#8217;s&#13;merger on August 9, 2019.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;Transaction costs relating to the IPO amounted&#13;to $2,882,226, consisting of $2,400,000 of underwriting fees and $482,226 of other costs.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;Following the closing of the IPO on October 10,&#13;2017, an amount of $120,600,000 ($10.05 per Unit) from the net proceeds of the sale of the Units in the IPO and the Placement Units was&#13;placed in a trust account (&amp;#8220;Trust Account&amp;#8221;) and invested in U.S. government securities, within the meaning set forth in Section&#13;2(a)(16) of the Investment Company Act of 1940, as amended (the &amp;#8220;Investment Company Act&amp;#8221;), with a maturity of 180 days or&#13;less or in any open-ended investment company that holds itself out as a money market fund selected by BRAC meeting the conditions of paragraphs&#13;(d)(2), (d)(3) and (d)(4) of Rule 2a-7 of the Investment Company Act, as determined by BRAC, until the earlier of: (i) the consummation&#13;of a Business Combination or (ii) the distribution of the Trust Account, as described below.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;On October 18, 2017, in connection with the underwriters&amp;#8217;&#13;exercise of their over-allotment option in full, BRAC sold an additional 1,800,000 Units and sold an additional 45,000 Placement Units&#13;to BROG at $10.00 per Unit, generating total proceeds of $18,450,000. Transaction costs for underwriting fees on the sale of the over-allotment&#13;units were $360,000. Following the closing, an additional $18,090,000 of the net proceeds ($10.05 per Unit) was placed in the Trust Account,&#13;bringing the total aggregate proceeds held in the Trust Account to $138,690,000 ($10.05 per Unit). BROG&amp;#8217;s investment in BRAC&amp;#8217;s&#13;common stock was eliminated in consolidation prior to the BRAC&amp;#8217;s merger on August 9, 2019.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;Upon the closing of the IPO, $10.05 per Unit sold&#13;in the IPO, including some of the proceeds of the Private Placements was deposited in a trust account (&amp;#8220;Trust Account&amp;#8221;) to&#13;be held until the earlier of (i) the consummation of its initial Business Combination or (ii) BRAC&amp;#8217;s failure to consummate a Business&#13;Combination within 21 months from the consummation of the IPO (the &amp;#8220;Combination Period&amp;#8221;).&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0&gt;&lt;i&gt;The Extension Meeting&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.15pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.15pt; text-align: justify&gt;On July 9, 2019, BRAC held a special&#13;meeting of its stockholders (the &amp;#8220;Meeting&amp;#8221;). At the Meeting, BRAC&amp;#8217;s stockholders considered a proposal to adopt and&#13;approve an amendment to BRAC&amp;#8217;s amended and restated certificate of incorporation (the &amp;#8220;Charter&amp;#8221;) to extend the date&#13;that BRAC had to consummate a business combination (the &amp;#8220;Extension&amp;#8221;) to August 10, 2019. The amendment was approved by the&#13;stockholders and filed with the Secretary of State of the State of Delaware on July 9, 2019.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.15pt; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.15pt; text-align: justify&gt;In connection with this vote, the holders&#13;of 9,246,727 shares of BRAC&amp;#8217;s common stock properly exercised their right to convert their shares into cash at a conversion price&#13;of approximately $10.29 per share resulting in $95,125,574 in Trust Account assets being distributed back to shareholders. In connection&#13;with the Extension, BROG loaned $30,000 to BRAC to be placed in the Trust Account for the benefit of the public shares that were not converted.&#13;The loan was non-interest bearing and evidenced by a promissory note issued by BRAC on the same date. The loan was repaid on August 12,&#13;2019.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0&gt;&lt;i&gt;Business Combination Agreement&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;On December 19, 2018, BRAC entered into the Business&#13;Combination Agreement with Merger Sub, Allied Esports, Ourgame, Noble and Primo. The Business Combination Agreement was amended on August&#13;5, 2019 and the Business Combination Agreement as amended is referred to as the Amended Business Combination Agreement. The merger closed&#13;on August 9, 2019 (the &amp;#8220;Closing Date&amp;#8221;).&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;Subject to the Amended Business Combination Agreement,&#13;(i) Noble merged with and into Allied Esports (the &amp;#8220;Redomestication Merger&amp;#8221;) with Allied Esports being the surviving entity&#13;in such merger and (ii) immediately after the Redomestication Merger, Merger Sub merged with into Allied Esports with Allied Esports being&#13;the surviving entity of such merger (the &amp;#8220;Transaction Merger&amp;#8221; and together with the Redomestication Merger, the &amp;#8220;Mergers&amp;#8221;).&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;The Mergers resulted in BRAC acquiring two of&#13;Ourgame&amp;#8217;s global esports and entertainment assets, Allied Esports and WPT. Allied Esports is a premier esports entertainment company&#13;with a global network of dedicated esports properties and content production facilities. WPT is the creator of the World Poker Tour&amp;#174;&#13;(WPT&amp;#174;) &amp;#8211; the premier name in internationally televised gaming and entertainment with brand presence in land-based tournaments,&#13;television, online and mobile. The transactions strategically combined the globally recognized Allied Esports brand with the three-pronged&#13;business model of the iconic World Poker Tour, featuring in-person experiences, multiplatform content and interactive services, to leverage&#13;the high-growth opportunities in the global esports industry.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;The Business Combination Agreement, which original&#13;called for a debt repayment to Ourgame of $35,000,000 was amended to call for BRAC to (i) assume $10,000,000 of the debt obligations of&#13;Ourgame and Noble (including an additional $1,200,000 of accrued interest) and (ii) repay Ourgame the remaining balance of $23,800,000&#13;by paying $3,500,000 in cash to Ourgame and its designees, issuing to Ourgame and its designees 2,928,679 shares of BRAC&amp;#8217;s common&#13;stock and Ourgame retaining $1,000,000 of the proceeds of such loans to pay its transaction expenses incurred in the Merger. In connection&#13;with entering into the Amendment, BROG, as BRAC&amp;#8217;s founder, agreed to transfer an aggregate of 600,000 shares of BRAC&amp;#8217;s common&#13;stock held by it to Ourgame.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;Additionally, In July and August 2019, BRAC and&#13;BROG entered into several share purchase agreements (the &amp;#8220;Purchase Agreements&amp;#8221;) with several parties (collectively referred&#13;to as the &amp;#8220;Purchasers&amp;#8221;). Pursuant to the Purchase Agreements, the Purchasers agreed to purchase an aggregate of $18,000,000&#13;of shares of BRAC&amp;#8217;s common stock in open market or privately negotiated transactions. If the Purchasers were unable to purchase&#13;the full $18,000,000 of shares of common stock in open market or privately negotiated transactions, BRAC will issue to the Purchasers&#13;newly issued shares at the Closing at a per-share price equal to the per-share amount held in BRAC&amp;#8217;s trust account ($10.30 per share),&#13;and having an aggregate value equal to the difference between $18,000,000 and the dollar amount of shares purchased by them in the open&#13;market or in privately negotiated transactions. At the Closing, BRAC agreed to issue to the Purchasers 1.5 shares of common stock for&#13;every 10 shares purchased by them under the Purchase Agreements. Additionally, BROG agreed to transfer an aggregate of 720,000 shares&#13;held by it of BRAC common stock to the Purchasers. Pursuant to the Purchase Agreements, BRAC is required to file a registration statement&#13;with the SEC as promptly as practicable following the closing of the merger to register the resale of any securities purchased by the&#13;Purchasers that are not already registered and cause such registration statement to become effective as soon as possible. The Purchasers&#13;included a $3&amp;#160;million investment from Lyle Berman, a member of the board of directors of both BRAC and BROG and the largest shareholder&#13;of BROG. Additionally, $5&amp;#160;million will be held in an escrow account and its usage will be limited to specific capital projects.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;Consummation of the transactions contemplated&#13;by the Amended Business Combination Agreement was subject to certain closing conditions including, among others, (i) approval by the stockholders&#13;of BRAC, and (ii) that BRAC have available cash in an amount not less than $22,000,000 after payment to stockholders who elect to redeem&#13;their shares of common stock in accordance with the provisions of BRAC&amp;#8217;s charter documents. This second condition was waived by&#13;Ourgame prior to the close.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;i&gt;Consolidation of BRAC and Non-controlling Interest&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;The Company determined that BRAC, following its&#13;IPO, was a VIE and that the Company is the primary beneficiary of the VIE. The Company determined that, due to the redemption feature&#13;associated with the IPO shares, that the IPO shareholders are indirectly protected from the operating expenses of BRAC and BROG had the&#13;power to direct the activities of BRAC through the date at which BRAC affords the stockholders the opportunity to vote to approve a proposed&#13;business combination. Therefore, the consolidated financial statements contain the operations of the BRAC from its inception on May 9,&#13;2017 through the date of the merger, when BRAC was determined to no longer be a VIE. BRAC&amp;#8217;s IPO shareholders are reflected in our&#13;Consolidated Financial Statements as a redeemable non-controlling interest prior to the merger. The non-controlling interest was recorded&#13;at fair value on October 10, 2017, with an addition on October 18, 2017 as a result of the underwriters&amp;#8217; exercise of their over-allotment&#13;option. During the period in which BRAC was consolidated, the net earnings attributable to the IPO shareholders are subtracted from the&#13;net gain (loss) for any period to arrive at the net loss attributable to the Company and the non-controlling interest on the balance sheet&#13;is adjusted to include the net earnings attributable to the IPO shareholders.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;i&gt;Deconsolidation of BRAC &lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;Additionally, US GAAP (ASC 810-10-40) provides&#13;guidance on &amp;#8220;Derecognition&amp;#8221; of a previously consolidated entity or entities. Under this guidance, the Company shall account&#13;for the deconsolidation of a subsidiary or derecognition of a group of assets specified in ASC 810-10-40-3A by recognizing a gain or loss&#13;in net income attributable to the parent, measured as the difference between the combination of:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;a) The fair value of:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=width: 100%; font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt&gt;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: top&gt;&#13;&lt;td style=width: 0.75in&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width: 0.25in&gt;&lt;font style=font-family: Symbol&gt;&amp;#183;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;any consideration received. In this case, the Company received no consideration.&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: top&gt;&#13;&lt;td style=width: 0.75in&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width: 0.25in&gt;&lt;font style=font-family: Symbol&gt;&amp;#183;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;any retained non-controlling investment in the former subsidiary or group of assets at the date the subsidiary is deconsolidated,&#13;or the group of assets is derecognized. In this case the fair value of the BRAC common stock at the close of the business combination&#13;was $11,950,475, and;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 1in; text-indent: -0.5in&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 1in; text-indent: -0.5in&gt;b) The carrying amount of the former subsidiaries&#13;assets and liabilities or the carrying amount of the group of assets.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;With the above guidance the Company determined&#13;that the effect of the deconsolidation of BRAC produced a non-cash adjustment, resulting in a gain of $20,448,687.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;i&gt;Intercompany Transactions and Eliminations&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Note&#13;6 &amp;#8211; Related Party&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;u&gt;Common&#13;Stock Awarded Pursuant to Business Combination&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify; background-color: white&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;On&#13;October 1, 2020, the Company issued 1,120,000 shares of common stock to S-FDF, LLC, a Texas limited liability company co-owned by Claudia&#13;and Ira Goldfarb, pursuant to an Asset Purchase Agreement, between the Company and the Seller. The issuance represented 41.18% of the&#13;Company&amp;#8217;s issued and outstanding common stock at the time. The fair value of the common stock was $6,720,000 based on the closing&#13;price of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock on the date of grant.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; color: black; background-color: white&gt;The&#13;number of Seller Shares to be issued was subject to adjustment, as specified in the amended Asset Purchase Agreement, based on the extent&#13;to which the amount of cash proceeds held by the Company, as derived from the sale of the Company&amp;#8217;s holdings of Allied Esports&#13;Entertainment Inc. (&amp;#34;AESE&amp;#34;) Shares, were less than $5&amp;#160;million or greater than $6&amp;#160;million on the date specified in the&#13;Asset Purchase Agreement. This resulted in an additional 500,973 Seller Shares that were issued on January 4, 2021. The combined issuances&#13;represented approximately 46% of the Company&amp;#8217;s issued and outstanding common stock, on a fully diluted basis. &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The&#13;fair value of the 500,673 shares was $1,853,600, based on the closing price of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock on the date of grant,&#13;was presented as Common Stock Payable as of December 31, 2020.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;u&gt;Common&#13;Stock Issued to Officers for Services, Common Stock Payable&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; color: black; background-color: white&gt;On&#13;January&amp;#160;4,&amp;#160;2021, the Board amended Claudia and Ira Goldfarb&amp;#8217;s employment agreements &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; color: black&gt;to&#13;issue shares of common stock in equal monthly increments of 5,541 and 6,044 shares, respectively, following each month of employment&#13;from October 2020 through December 31, 2021. &lt;font style=background-color: white&gt;The Company awarded an aggregate 16,623 and 18,133&#13;shares of common stock to Claudia and Ira, respectively, for their services from October through December 31, 2020 as a common stock&#13;payable. The aggregate fair value of the shares was $61,505 and $67,092 for Claudia and Ira, respectively, based on the closing price&#13;of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock on the date of grant&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;,&#13;was presented as Common Stock Payable as of December 31, 2020&lt;font style=color: black; background-color: white&gt;. The shares were subsequently&#13;issued on January 4, 2021.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;u&gt;Common&#13;Stock Issued to Directors for Services&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; background-color: white&gt;On&#13;October&amp;#160;1,&amp;#160;2020, the Company issued an aggregate 20,835 shares of common stock amongst its five Directors for annual services&#13;to be rendered. The aggregate fair value of the common stock was $125,010, based on the closing price of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock&#13;on the date of grant. The shares were expensed upon issuance.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; background-color: white&gt;On&#13;October&amp;#160;1,&amp;#160;2020, the Company issued an additional 2&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;,500&#13;shares to Mr. Benjamin Oehler, for Audit Committee Chair services. &lt;font style=background-color: white&gt;The fair value of the common&#13;stock was $15,000, based on the closing price of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock on the date of grant. The shares were expensed upon&#13;issuance.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;&lt;u&gt;Management&#13;Incentive Plan&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;On&#13;March 1, 2018, the Board of Directors (the &amp;#8220;Board&amp;#8221;) of the Company approved and adopted the Black Ridge Gas, Inc. 2018 Management&#13;Incentive Plan (the &amp;#8220;Plan&amp;#8221;) and the form of 2018 Management Incentive Plan Award Agreement (the &amp;#8220;Award Agreement&amp;#8221;).&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;In&#13;connection with the approval of the Plan and Award Agreement, the Board approved the issuance of awards (the &amp;#8220;Awards&amp;#8221;) to&#13;certain individuals including officers and directors (the &amp;#8220;Grantees&amp;#8221;), representing a percentage of the shares of BRAC held&#13;by the Company as of the date of closing of a business combination for the acquisition of a target business as described in the BRAC&#13;prospectus dated October 4, 2017, as follows:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 align=center style=width: 80%; border-collapse: collapse; font-size: 10pt&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 24%; text-align: center&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;Kenneth DeCubellis&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: center&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;4.0%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Michael Eisele&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: center&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;2.8%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: #CCFFCC&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;James Moe&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: center&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;2.1%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Following&#13;the AESE merger on August 9, 2019, the Company owned 2,685,500 shares of AESE common stock and 505,000 warrants to purchase AESE (NASDAQ:&#13;AESEW). During the year ended December 31, 2020, the Company sold some of these securities, resulting in gross proceeds of $3,181,735,&#13;consisting of 1,970,920 shares of common stock for total proceeds of $3,108,067, and the sale of warrants to purchase 505,000 shares&#13;for total proceeds of $73,668. The Company also distributed 537,101 Sponsor Shares on August&amp;#160;9, 2020 to employees and directors&#13;under the 2018 Management Incentive Plan. Employees and directors were required to remain in their positions for a one-year period from&#13;the AESE merger, with certain exceptions, to receive the granted shares. The AESE Plan Shares had a fair market value of $1,133,281 on&#13;August 10, 2020, when the shares were distributed. The Company recognized $1,396,460 of compensation expense related to the Plan during&#13;the year ended December 31, 2019.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;u&gt;Lease&#13;Agreement&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Upon&#13;closing of the Asset Purchase Agreement, the Company assumed the Seller&amp;#8217;s obligations under a real property lease for its 20,945&#13;square foot facility in Irving, Texas, under which an entity owned entirely by Ira Goldfarb is the landlord. The lease term is through&#13;September 15, 2025, with two five-year options to extend, at a monthly lease term of $10,036, with approximately a 3% annual escalation&#13;of lease payments commencing September 15, 2021.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;u&gt;Shares&#13;Transferred to Purchasers of BRAC Common Stock&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Note&#13;7 &amp;#8211; Fair Value of Financial Instruments&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Under&#13;FASB ASC 820-10-5, fair value is defined as the price that would be received to sell an asset or paid to transfer a liability in an orderly&#13;transaction between market participants at the measurement date (an exit price). The standard outlines a valuation framework and creates&#13;a fair value hierarchy in order to increase the consistency and comparability of fair value measurements and the related disclosures.&#13;Under GAAP, certain assets and liabilities must be measured at fair value, and FASB ASC 820-10-50 details the disclosures that are required&#13;for items measured at fair value.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The&#13;Company has cash and cash equivalents and a revolving credit facility that must be measured under the fair value standard. The Company&amp;#8217;s&#13;financial assets and liabilities are measured using inputs from the three levels of the fair value hierarchy. The three levels are as&#13;follows:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 30.6pt; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Level&#13;1 - Inputs are unadjusted quoted prices in active markets for identical assets or liabilities that the Company has the ability to access&#13;at the measurement date.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 30.6pt; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 30.6pt; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Level&#13;2 - Inputs include quoted prices for similar assets and liabilities in active markets, quoted prices for identical or similar assets&#13;or liabilities in markets that are not active, inputs other than quoted prices that are observable for the asset or liability (e.g.,&#13;interest rates, yield curves, etc.), and inputs that are derived principally from or corroborated by observable market data by correlation&#13;or other means (market corroborated inputs).&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 30.6pt; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 30.6pt; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Level&#13;3 - Unobservable inputs that reflect our assumptions about the assumptions that market participants would use in pricing the asset or&#13;liability.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The&#13;following schedule summarizes the valuation of financial instruments at fair value on a recurring basis in the balances sheet as of December&amp;#160;31,2020&#13;and 2019:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=border-collapse: collapse; width: 100%&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=font-size: 10pt&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; padding-bottom: 1pt&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan=10 style=border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; font-size: 10pt; text-align: center&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Fair&#13;    Value Measurements at December 31, 2020&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt; font-size: 10pt&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=font-size: 10pt&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; padding-bottom: 1pt&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan=2 style=border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; font-size: 10pt; text-align: center&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Level&#13;    1&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt; font-size: 10pt&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; padding-bottom: 1pt&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan=2 style=border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; font-size: 10pt; text-align: center&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Level&#13;    2&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt; font-size: 10pt&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; padding-bottom: 1pt&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan=2 style=border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; font-size: 10pt; text-align: center&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Level&#13;    3&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt; font-size: 10pt&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: rgb(204
255
204)&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; font-weight: bold&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Assets&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan=2 style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan=2 style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan=2 style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times

 Serif&gt;)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: White&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: left; padding-bottom: 2.5pt; text-indent: 9pt&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Total&#13;    property and equipment, net&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 2.5pt double; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 2.5pt double; font-size: 10pt; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;2,134,572&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;6,399&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;/table&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Serif; margin: 0pt 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Construction&#13;in progress consists of costs incurred to build out our manufacturing facility in Irving Texas, along with the construction of our freeze&#13;driers. These costs will be capitalized as Leasehold Improvements and Machinery, respectively, upon completion.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;On&#13;September 30, 2020, the Company disposed of computer equipment no longer in service. No proceeds were received on the disposal of the&#13;equipment, resulting in a loss on disposal of fixed assets of $5,369, which represented the net book value at the time of disposal.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Serif; margin: 0pt 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Note&#13;10 &amp;#8211; Investment in Allied Esports Entertainment, Inc.&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Following&#13;the close of BRAC&amp;#8217;s merger, the Company retained 2,685,500 shares of AESE common stock with a value, based on the closing stock&#13;of $4.45 on the merger, of $11,950,475, and tradeable warrants to purchase 505,000 shares of AESE (NASDAQ: AESEW) (&amp;#8220;Sponsor Warrants&amp;#8221;),&#13;of which the Company still owned 177,479 shares as of December 31, 2020, after selling 1,970,920 shares for total net proceeds of $3,108,067,&#13;selling warrants to purchase 505,000 Sponsor Warrants for total proceeds of $73,668, and distributing 537,101 Sponsor Shares on August&#13;10, 2020 to employees and directors under the 2018 Management Incentive Plan. As noted above, in Note 6 - Related Party Transactions,&#13;20% or 537,101, of the shares were released to employees on August 10, 2020. Therefore, the Company recorded compensation expense and&#13;recorded a deferred compensation liability of $1,396,460 to recognize the commitment to employees in 2019.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;As&#13;of December 31, 2020, the market value of the Company&amp;#8217;s investment in AESE&amp;#8217;s common stock was $280,417, based on the closing&#13;stock price of $1.58 per share, resulting in losses on our investment in securities, as follows:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Note&#13;11 &amp;#8211; Leases&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; color: black&gt;The&#13;Company leases its &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;20,945 square foot &lt;font style=color: black&gt;operating&#13;and office &lt;/font&gt;facility under a non&lt;font style=color: black&gt;-cancelable real property lease agreement that expires on August 31,&#13;2025&lt;/font&gt;, with two five-year options to extend, at a monthly lease term of $10,036, with approximately a 3% annual escalation of lease&#13;payments commencing September 15, 2021, &lt;font style=color: black&gt;subject to the ASU 2016-02. In the locations in which it is economically&#13;feasible to continue to operate, management expects to enter into a new lease upon expiration. The operating and office facility lease&#13;contains provisions requiring payment of property taxes, utilities, insurance, maintenance and other occupancy costs applicable to the&#13;leased premise. As the Company&amp;#8217;s leases do not provide implicit discount rates, the Company uses an incremental borrowing rate&#13;based on the information available at the commencement date in determining the present value of lease payments.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=color: black&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The&#13;components of lease expense were as follows:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;81,720&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width: 1%; padding-bottom: 2.5pt; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;On&#13;    June 16, 2020, the Company entered into a loan authorization and loan agreement with the United States Small Business Administration&#13;    (the &amp;#8220;SBA&amp;#8221;), as lender, pursuant to the SBA&amp;#8217;s Economic Injury Disaster Loan (&amp;#8220;EIDL&amp;#8221;) assistance program&#13;    in light of the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on the Company&amp;#8217;s business (the &amp;#8220;EIDL Loan Agreement&amp;#8221;) encompassing&#13;    a $150,000 Promissory Note issued to the SBA (the &amp;#8220;EIDL Note&amp;#8221;)(together with the EIDL Loan Agreement, the &amp;#8220;EIDL&#13;    Loan&amp;#8221;), bearing interest at 3.75% per annum. In connection with entering into the EIDL Loan, the Company also executed a security&#13;    agreement, dated June 16, 2020, between the SBA and the Company (the &amp;#8220;EIDL Security Agreement&amp;#8221;) pursuant to which the&#13;    EIDL Loan is secured by a security interest on all of the Company&amp;#8217;s assets. Under the EIDL Note, the Company is required to&#13;    pay principal and interest payments of $731 every month beginning June 16, 2021. All remaining principal and accrued interest is&#13;    due and payable on June 16, 2050. The EIDL Note may be repaid at any time without penalty.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width: 2%; font-size: 10pt&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 1%; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width: 8%; font-size: 10pt; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;150,000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width: 1%; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width: 2%; font-size: 10pt&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 1%; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width: 8%; font-size: 10pt; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;&amp;#8211;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width: 1%; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: White&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: rgb(204
255
204)&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;On&#13;    April 24, 2020, the Company entered into a loan agreement with Kensington Bank (&amp;#8220;Kensington&amp;#8221;), as lender (the &amp;#8220;Loan&#13;    Agreement&amp;#8221;) encompassing a $112,925 Promissory Note issued to Kensington (the &amp;#8220;PPP Note&amp;#8221;) pursuant to Payroll Protection&#13;    Program established as part of the Coronavirus Aid, Relief, and Economic Security Act (the &amp;#8220;CARES Act&amp;#8221;), which provides&#13;    loans to qualifying businesses and is administered by the U.S. Small Business Administration (the &amp;#8220;SBA&amp;#8221;). The PPP Note&#13;    bears interest at 1.00% per annum, with interest payable monthly beginning November 24, 2020, and principal due in full on April&#13;    24, 2022. The PPP Note may be repaid at any time without penalty. Under the Payroll Protection Program, the Company will be eligible&#13;    for loan forgiveness up to the full amount of the PPP Note and any accrued interest. The forgiveness amount will be equal to the&#13;    amount that the Company spends during the 24-week period beginning April 24, 2020 on payroll costs, payment of rent on any leases&#13;    in force prior to February 15, 2020 and payment on any utility for which service began before February 15, 2020. The maximum amount&#13;    of loan forgiveness for non-payroll expenses is 40% of the amount of the PPP Note. On January&amp;#160;19, 2021, the Company received&#13;    forgiveness, as authorized by Section 1106 of the Cares Act in the amount of $113,772, consisting of $112,925 of principal and $847&#13;    of interest.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;112,925&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#8211;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: White&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: rgb(204
255
204)&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;On November&#13;    25, 2019, the Company entered into a credit account agreement (&amp;#8220;Margin Account&amp;#8221;) with RBC Capital Markets, LLC (&amp;#8220;RBC&amp;#8221;).&#13;    The Margin Account enables the Company to borrow against the Company&amp;#8217;s AESE shares that are held in an account with RBC. The&#13;    advances received on margin bear interest at rates of between 1.00% and 2.75% over the Base Lending Rate, depending on the average&#13;    outstanding debit balance. The Base Lending Rate is internally determined by RBC using Broker Call, Prime Rate as determined by commercial&#13;    banks utilized by RBC CM, Fed Funds, RBC CM&amp;#8217;s cost of funds, and other commercially recognized rates of interest. The margin&#13;    loans are collateralized by the underlying AESE shares. A total of $122,100 was borrowed on the Margin Account over various dates&#13;    between January 29, 2020 and March 6, 2020. The outstanding balance was repaid in full on, or about, March 12, 2020 out of the proceeds&#13;    of the loan from Cadence Bank, described below.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#8211;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#8211;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: White&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: rgb(204
255
204)&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; padding-bottom: 1pt&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;On&#13;    March 12, 2020, the Company entered into a business loan agreement with Cadence&amp;#160;Bank, N.A. (&amp;#8220;Cadence&amp;#8221;), as lender&#13;    encompassing a $700,000 Promissory Note issued to&amp;#160;Cadence (the &amp;#8220;Note&amp;#8221;), a Security Agreement by the Company in favor&#13;    of&amp;#160;Cadence and limited commercial guarantees by the Company&amp;#8217;s Chief Executive Officer and Interim Chief Financial Officer,&#13;    who is one in the same, and members of the Company&amp;#8217;s Board of Directors (the &amp;#8220;Guarantors&amp;#8221;) (collectively, the &amp;#8220;Cadence&#13;    Loan&amp;#8221;). The Note carried interest at a rate of 0.50 percentage points over the prime rate, as published in the Wall Street&#13;    Journal, payable monthly, and was due on March 9, 2021. The Note could be repaid at any time without penalty. The Note was secured&#13;    by all of the Company&amp;#8217;s rights, title and interests in and to 500,000 shares of the common stock of Allied Esports Entertainment&#13;    Inc. (NASDAQ: AESE) currently owned by the Company and held in the Company&amp;#8217;s brokerage account with&amp;#160;RBC&amp;#160;Capital Markets,&#13;    LLC. On March 26, 2020, the Company subsequently entered into a separate letter agreement with the Guarantors (the &amp;#8220;Letter&#13;    Agreement&amp;#8221;), which provides that if the Company defaults or fails to make any payment due under the Cadence Loan and the Guarantors&#13;    are required to make payment to Cadence pursuant to the Guarantees, then the Company agrees to issue additional equity interests&#13;    or rights to Guarantors reflecting ninety-five percent (95%) of the outstanding equity of the Company at the time of such default&#13;    to participating Guarantors who have made the payments to Cadence. All equity issuances will be subject to any third party or shareholder&#13;    approvals required at the time of issuance. A total of $417,000 was advanced on the loan and subsequently repaid in full on June&#13;    30, 2020.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; padding-bottom: 1pt&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; font-size: 10pt; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times

 Serif&gt;Notes&#13;    payable, less current maturities&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 2.5pt double; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 2.5pt double; font-size: 10pt; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;262,925&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
