 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 2.5pt double; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 2.5pt double; font-size: 10pt; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#8211;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;/table&gt;&#13;&#13;&#13;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The&#13;Company recorded total discounts of $377,440, consisting of debt discounts on warrants granted to four officers and directors for warrants&#13;issued in consideration of personal guarantees provided for debt financing incurred during the year ended December&amp;#160;31, 2020. The&#13;discounts were amortized to stock-based compensation expense over the term of the note, until repayment, using the straight-line method,&#13;which closely approximated the effective interest method. The Company recorded $377,440 of stock-based compensation expense pursuant&#13;to the amortization of note discounts during the year ended December&amp;#160;31, 2020.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;b&gt;Note 13 &amp;#8211; Stockholders&amp;#8217; Equity&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify; background-color: white&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;u&gt;Reverse Stock Split&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=color: black&gt;On February 21, 2020,&#13;the Company effected a 1-for-300 &lt;/font&gt;reverse stock split (the &amp;#8220;Reverse Stock Split&amp;#8221;)&lt;font style=color: black&gt;. &lt;/font&gt;No&#13;fractional shares were issued. Instead, the Company issued the following to any stockholder who otherwise would have received a fractional&#13;share as a result of the Reverse Stock Split:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 style=width: 100%; font-size: 10pt&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style=vertical-align: top&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 24px&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 24px&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Symbol&gt;&amp;#183;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;Stockholders owning 300 or more shares of Common Stock received (1) one share of Common Stock for every 300 shares owned and (2) cash in lieu of fractional shares upon the surrender of such stockholder&amp;#8217;s shares;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style=vertical-align: top&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Symbol&gt;&amp;#183;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;Stockholders owning between 25 and 300 shares of Common Stock had their ownership of shares of Common Stock rounded up to one share; and&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style=vertical-align: top&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Symbol&gt;&amp;#183;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;Stockholders owning fewer than 25 shares of Common Stock received cash in lieu of fractional shares upon the surrender of such stockholders&amp;#8217; shares and no longer own shares of Common Stock.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;Any cash payment in lieu of fractional shares&#13;were based on the&amp;#160;volume weighted average of the closing sales prices of the Company&amp;#8217;s Common Stock on the OTCQB operated by&#13;OTC Markets Group Inc. (the &amp;#8220;OTCQB&amp;#8221;) during regular trading hours for the five consecutive trading days immediately preceding&#13;the Effective Date, which was $0.018 per share prior to the effects of the reverse stock split.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;The Company was authorized to issue 500,000,000&#13;shares of common stock prior to the Reverse Stock Split, which remains unaffected. The Reverse Stock Split did not have any effect on&#13;the stated par value of the common stock, or the Company&amp;#8217;s authorized preferred stock. Unless otherwise stated, all share and per&#13;share information in this Interim Report has been retroactively adjusted to reflect the Reverse Stock Split.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify; background-color: white&gt;&lt;u&gt;Preferred Stock&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;The Company has 20,000,000 authorized shares of&#13;$0.001 par value preferred stock. No shares have been issued to date.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify; background-color: white&gt;&lt;u&gt;Common Stock&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;The Company has 500,000,000 authorized shares&#13;of $0.001 par value common stock. As of December 31, 2020, a total of 12,742,890 shares of common stock have been issued.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;u&gt;Common Stock Awarded Pursuant to Business Combination&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify; background-color: white&gt;On October 1, 2020, the&#13;Company issued 1,120,000 shares of common stock to S-FDF, LLC, a Texas limited liability company, pursuant to an Asset Purchase Agreement,&#13;between the Company and the Seller. The issuance represented 41.18% of the Company&amp;#8217;s issued and outstanding common stock at the&#13;time. The fair value of the common stock was $6,720,000 based on the closing price of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock on the date of&#13;grant.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=color: black; background-color: white&gt;The&#13;number of Seller Shares to be issued was subject to adjustment, as specified in the amended Asset Purchase Agreement, based on the extent&#13;to which the amount of cash proceeds held by the Company, as derived from the sale of the Company&amp;#8217;s holdings of Allied Esports Entertainment&#13;Inc. (&amp;#34;AESE&amp;#34;) Shares, were less than $5&amp;#160;million or greater than $6&amp;#160;million on the date specified in the Asset Purchase&#13;Agreement. This resulted in an additional 500,973 Seller Shares that were issued on January 4, 2021. The combined issuances represented&#13;approximately 46% of the Company&amp;#8217;s issued and outstanding common stock, on a fully diluted basis. &lt;/font&gt;The fair value of the 500,673&#13;shares was $1,853,600, based on the closing price of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock on the date of grant, was presented as Common Stock&#13;Payable as of December 31, 2020.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;u&gt;Common Stock Issued to Officers for Services,&#13;Common Stock Payable&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=color: black; background-color: white&gt;On&#13;January&amp;#160;4,&amp;#160;2021, the Board amended Claudia and Ira Goldfarb&amp;#8217;s employment agreements &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=color: black&gt;to&#13;issue shares of common stock in equal monthly increments of 5,541 and 6,044 shares, respectively, following each month of employment from&#13;October 2020 through December 31, 2021. &lt;font style=background-color: white&gt;The Company awarded an aggregate 16,623 and 18,133 shares&#13;of common stock to Claudia and Ira, respectively, for their services from October through December 31, 2020 as a common stock payable.&#13;The aggregate fair value of the shares was $61,505 and $67,092 for Claudia and Ira, respectively, based on the closing price of the Company&amp;#8217;s&#13;common stock on the date of grant&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;, was presented as Common Stock Payable as of December 31, 2020&lt;font style=color: black; background-color: white&gt;.&#13;The shares were subsequently issued on January 4, 2021.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;u&gt;Common Stock Issued to Directors for Services&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=background-color: white&gt;On October&amp;#160;1,&amp;#160;2020,&#13;the Company issued an aggregate 20,835 shares of common stock amongst its five Directors for annual services to be rendered. The aggregate&#13;fair value of the common stock was $125,010, based on the closing price of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock on the date of grant. The&#13;shares were expensed upon issuance.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=background-color: white&gt;On October&amp;#160;1,&amp;#160;2020,&#13;the Company issued an additional 2&lt;/font&gt;,500 shares to Mr. Benjamin Oehler, for Audit Committee Chair services. &lt;font style=background-color: white&gt;The&#13;fair value of the common stock was $15,000, based on the closing price of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock on the date of grant. The shares&#13;were expensed upon issuance.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Note&#13;14 &amp;#8211; Options&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The&#13;&lt;font style=color: black&gt;2020 Equity Plan was approved by written consent of a majority of shareholders of record as of November 12,&#13;2019 and adopted by the Board on &lt;/font&gt;December 5, 2019, as provided in the definitive information statement filed with Securities and&#13;Exchange Commission on January 10, 2020 (the &amp;#8220;DEF 14C&amp;#8221;). The description of the &lt;font style=color: black&gt;2020 Equity Plan&#13;&lt;/font&gt;is qualified in its entirety by the text of the &lt;font style=color: black&gt;2020 Equity Plan, a copy of which was attached as Annex&#13;C to the DEF 14C.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;u&gt;Outstanding&#13;Options&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Options&#13;to purchase an aggregate total of 459,524 shares of common stock at a weighted average strike price of $8.70, exercisable over a weighted&#13;average life of 9.22 years were outstanding as of December 31, 2020.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;u&gt;Options&#13;Granted&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; color: black&gt;On&#13;December 28, 2020, (a) Mr. Burke was granted options to purchase 20,000 shares of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock, (b) Ira Goldfarb&#13;was granted options to purchase 16,500 shares of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock, and (c) Claudia Goldfarb was granted options to purchase&#13;16,500 shares of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock, each grant having an exercise price of $4.00 per share, which represents the closing&#13;price of the Company&amp;#8217;s shares on the OTCQB marketplace on December 28, 2020 (collectively, the &amp;#8220;Executive Option Grants&amp;#8221;).&#13;The Executive Option Grants will vest 60% as of January 1, 2024 and 20% each anniversary thereafter until fully vested. &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The&#13;aggregate estimated value using the Black-Scholes Pricing Model, based on a volatility rate of 201.05% and a call option value of $3.9657,&#13;was $210,185. The options are being expensed over the vesting period, resulting in $ 344 of stock-based compensation expense during the&#13;year ended December 31, 2020. As of December 31, 2020, a total of $209,841 of unamortized expenses are expected to be expensed over the&#13;vesting period&lt;font style=color: black&gt;.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; color: black&gt;On&#13;December 28, 2020, two employees were granted options to purchase an aggregate 6,750 shares of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock, each&#13;grant having an exercise price of $4.00 per share, which represents the closing price of the Company&amp;#8217;s shares on the OTCQB marketplace&#13;on December 28, 2020. The option grants will vest 60% as of January 1, 2024 and 20% each anniversary thereafter until fully vested. &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The&#13;aggregate estimated value using the Black-Scholes Pricing Model, based on a volatility rate of 201.05% and a call option value of $3.9657,&#13;was $26,769. The options are being expensed over the vesting period, resulting in $44 of stock-based compensation expense during the&#13;year ended December 31, 2020. As of December 31, 2020, a total of $26,725 of unamortized expenses are expected to be expensed over the&#13;vesting period&lt;font style=color: black&gt;.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; color: black&gt;On&#13;October 2, 2020, the Company&amp;#8217;s Board of Directors granted an aggregate amount of 115,250 stock options pursuant to the 2020 Equity&#13;Plan to purchase shares of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock to several officers, directors, and employees at an exercise price of $5.25&#13;per share, which represents the closing price of the Company&amp;#8217;s shares on the OTCQB marketplace on October&amp;#160;2, 2020. The options&#13;are exercisable over a ten-year term, and vest 60% on the 3&lt;sup&gt;rd&lt;/sup&gt; anniversary of the grant date and 20% each anniversary thereafter,&#13;until fully vested. &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The aggregate estimated value using&#13;the Black-Scholes Pricing Model, based on a volatility rate of 532.91% and a call option value of $5.2102, was $600,473. The options&#13;are being expensed over the vesting period, resulting in $27,667 of stock-based compensation expense during the year ended December 31,&#13;2020. As of December 31, 2020, a total of $572,806 of unamortized expenses are expected to be expensed over the vesting period. &lt;font style=color: black&gt;The&#13;officers and directors receiving grants and the amounts of such grants were as follows:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Times
 Serif&gt;On&#13;October 1, 2020, Mr. Greg Creed was granted options to purchase 24,151 shares of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock at an exercise price&#13;of $6.00 per share, which represented the closing price of the Company&amp;#8217;s shares on the OTCQB marketplace on October&amp;#160;1, 2020.&#13;These options will vest 60% as of January 1, 2024 and 20% each anniversary thereafter until fully vested. The estimated value using the&#13;Black-Scholes Pricing Model, based on a volatility rate of 552.14% and a call option value of $5.9660, was $144,084. The options are&#13;being expensed over the vesting period, resulting in $6,633 of stock-based compensation expense during the year ended December 31, 2020.&#13;As of December 31, 2020, a total of $137,451 of unamortized expenses are expected to be expensed over the vesting period.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; color: black&gt;On&#13;February 26, 2020, the Company&amp;#8217;s Board of Directors granted an aggregate amount of 240,000 stock options pursuant to the 2020 Equity&#13;Plan to purchase shares of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock to several officers, directors, and employees at an exercise price of $5.41&#13;per share, which represents the closing price of the Company&amp;#8217;s shares on the OTCQB marketplace on February 20, 2020. &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The&#13;aggregate estimated value using the Black-Scholes Pricing Model, based on a volatility rate of 147.98% and a call option value of $3.7354,&#13;was $896,506. The options are being expensed over the vesting period, resulting in $408,964 of stock-based compensation expense during&#13;the year ended December 31, 2020. As of December 31, 2020, a total of $487,541 of unamortized expenses are expected to be expensed over&#13;the vesting period. &lt;font style=color: black&gt;The officers and directors receiving grants and the amounts of such grants were as follows:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;Total:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 2.5pt double; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 2.5pt double; font-size: 10pt; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;199,245&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;/table&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;All&#13;of the stock options granted under the 2020 Equity Plan presented in the table above will vest in five equal installments, commencing&#13;one year from the date of grant on February 26, 2021, and continuing for the next four anniversaries thereof until fully vested.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The&#13;Company recognized a total of $458,048, and $100,526 of compensation expense during the years ended December&amp;#160;31, 2020 and 2019,&#13;respectively, related to common stock options issued to Employees and Directors that are being amortized over the implied service term,&#13;or vesting period, of the options. The remaining unamortized balance of these options is $1,434,364 as of December&amp;#160;31, 2020.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;No&#13;options were granted during the year ended December 31, 2019.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;u&gt;Options&#13;Cancelled or Forfeited&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;An&#13;aggregate 13,164 and 1,284 options with a weighted average strike price of $107.94 and $27.18 per share were forfeited by former employees&#13;during the years ended December 31, 2020 and 2019, respectively.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;u&gt;Options&#13;Expired&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;An&#13;aggregate 666 and 457 options with a weighted average strike price of $195.00 and $90.51 per share expired during the years ended December&#13;31, 2020 and 2019, respectively.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Times
 Serif&gt;No&#13;options were exercised during the years ended December&amp;#160;31,&amp;#160;2020 and 2019.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Note&#13;15 &amp;#8211; Warrants&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;u&gt;Outstanding&#13;Warrants&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Warrants&#13;to purchase an aggregate total of 106,300 shares of common stock at a $3.99 strike price, exercisable over a weighted average life of&#13;9.1 years were outstanding as of December 31, 2020.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;u&gt;Warrants&#13;Granted&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;In&#13;consideration for four officers and director&amp;#8217;s willingness to serve as guarantors of the Cadence Loan, the Company issued warrants&#13;to each of the Guarantors (the &amp;#8220;Guarantor Warrants&amp;#8221;) for the purchase of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock on March 12, 2020.&#13;The Guarantor Warrants entitle each Guarantor to purchase 26,250 shares of the Company's common stock (the &amp;#8220;Warrant Shares&amp;#8221;)&#13;at an exercise price of $4.00 per share. The Guarantor Warrants expire on March 12, 2030. The officers and directors receiving grants&#13;and the amounts of such grants were as follows:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=border-collapse: collapse; width: 100%&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: center&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times

 Serif&gt;Exercisable,&#13;    December 31, 2020&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 2.5pt double; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Times
 Serif&gt;3.99&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Note&#13;16 &amp;#8211; Income Taxes&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;We&#13;account for income taxes under the provisions of ASC Topic 740, &lt;i&gt;Income taxes, &lt;/i&gt;which provides for an asset and liability approach&#13;for income taxes. Under this approach, deferred tax assets and liabilities are recognized based on anticipated future tax consequences,&#13;using currently enacted tax laws, attributable to temporary differences between the carrying amounts of assets and liabilities for financial&#13;reporting purposes and the amounts calculated for income tax purposes.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Our&#13;provision for income taxes for the years ended December&amp;#160;31,&amp;#160;2020 and 2019 consisted of the following:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times

255

 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;(5,489,828&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;(6,010,207&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: White&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: left; padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Deferred&#13;    tax assets (liabilities)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 2.5pt double; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 2.5pt double; font-size: 10pt; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#8211;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 2.5pt double; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 2.5pt double; font-size: 10pt; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#8211;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;/table&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;As&#13;of December&amp;#160;31,&amp;#160;2020, the Company has a net operating loss carryover of approximately $30,592,014. Under existing Federal law,&#13;a portion of the net operating loss may be utilized to offset taxable income through the year ended December&amp;#160;31,&amp;#160;2037. A portion&#13;of the net operating loss carryover begins to expire in 2030. For tax years beginning after December 31, 2017, pursuant to the enactment&#13;of the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act (&amp;#8220;TCJA&amp;#8221;) net operating losses now carry forward indefinitely but are limited to offsetting 80%&#13;of taxable income in a tax year. Of the total net operating loss as of December 31, 2020, approximately $4,837,882 of the Company&amp;#8217;s&#13;NOL is subject to the TCJA net operating loss provisions.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;ASC&#13;Topic 740 provides that a valuation allowance is recognized if, based on the weight of available evidence, it is more likely than not&#13;that some portion or all of the deferred tax asset will not be realized. In 2020, BROG decreased its valuation allowance from $6,010,207&#13;to $5,489,828 to adjust for the decrease in net deferred tax assets primarily due to an unrealized gain recorded for book purposes related&#13;to the investment in Allied Esports Entertainment, Inc. The Company believes it is more likely than not that the benefit of these remaining&#13;assets will not be realized. The Company did not place a valuation allowance on deferred tax asset for BRAC related to the capitalized&#13;merger and acquisition costs.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The&#13;Company filed annual US Federal income tax returns and annual income tax returns for the state of Minnesota through 2020. Going forward,&#13;it will file annual state income tax returns for the state of Texas. We are not subject to income tax examinations by tax authorities&#13;for years before 2015 for all returns. Income taxing authorities have conducted no formal examinations of our past federal or state income&#13;tax returns and supporting records.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in&gt;&lt;b&gt;Note 18 &amp;#8211; Subsequent&#13;Events&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;The Company evaluates events that have occurred&#13;after the balance sheet date through the date hereof, which these financial statements were issued. No events occurred of a material nature&#13;that would have required adjustments to or disclosure in these financial statements except as follows:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;u&gt;Issuance of Shares in Completion of Acquisition&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=color: black&gt;In connection with&#13;the closing of the Amended Asset Purchase Agreement between the Company and S-FDF, LLC, the Company was obligated to make certain adjustments&#13;to the common stock issued to Seller. The adjustment was based primarily on the fair value of AESE shares sold subsequent to the Asset&#13;Purchase Agreement. On December 31, 2020, the final number of shares to be issued to S-FDF, LLC was determined to be 500,973 shares and&#13;a common stock payable was recognized in the amount of $1,853,600&lt;/font&gt;, the fair value of the common stock based on the closing price&#13;of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock on the date of grant. &lt;font style=color: black&gt;On January&amp;#160;4, 2021, the 500,973 shares were&#13;issued in settlement of the common stock payable.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;u&gt;Common Stock Issued to Officers on Common Stock&#13;Payable&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=background-color: white&gt;On January&amp;#160;7,&amp;#160;2021,&#13;the Company issued an aggregate 16,623 and 18,133 shares of common stock to Claudia and Ira Goldfarb&lt;/font&gt;, respectively, for services&#13;from October 2020 through December 31, 2020 in satisfaction of the outstanding &lt;font style=background-color: white&gt;common stock payable.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;u&gt;Issuance of Shares for Services&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=background-color: white&gt;On January&amp;#160;27,&amp;#160;2021,&#13;upon Benjamin Oehler&amp;#8217;s resignation, the Company a&lt;/font&gt;ppointed Chris Ludeman as a member of the Board of Directors of the Company,&#13;and appointed him to the Company&amp;#8217;s Audit Committee as Chairperson. Pursuant to his appointment, Mr. Ludeman was &lt;font style=background-color: white&gt;issued&#13;6,400 shares of common stock for his services to be rendered. The aggregate fair value of the common stock was $40,000, based on the closing&#13;price of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock on the date of grant.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=background-color: white&gt;On January&amp;#160;31,&amp;#160;2021,&#13;the Company issued&lt;/font&gt; 5,541 and 6,044 shares &lt;font style=background-color: white&gt;to Claudia and Ira Goldfarb&lt;/font&gt;, respectively&lt;font style=background-color: white&gt;,&#13;for their services for January 2021. The aggregate fair value of the shares was $29,035 and $31,671 for Claudia and Ira, respectively,&#13;based on the closing price of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock on the date of grant.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=background-color: white&gt;On February&amp;#160;28,&amp;#160;2021,&#13;the Company issued&lt;/font&gt; 5,541 and 6,044 shares &lt;font style=background-color: white&gt;to Claudia and Ira Goldfarb&lt;/font&gt;, respectively&lt;font style=background-color: white&gt;,&#13;for their services for February 2021. The aggregate fair value of the shares was $38,787 and $42,308 for Claudia and Ira, respectively,&#13;based on the closing price of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock on the date of grant.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;u&gt;Common Stock Sold for Cash&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;On February 5, 2021, the Company entered into&#13;a Stock Purchase Agreement with multiple accredited investors to sell and issue to the Purchasers an aggregate 631,250 shares of the Company&amp;#8217;s&#13;common stock at a price of $4.00 per share for total proceeds of $2,525,000. A total of 300,000 of these shares, or proceeds of $1,200,000&#13;were purchased by related parties.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;u&gt;Options Granted&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;On January 4, 2021, Claudia and Ira Goldfarb were&#13;each granted options to purchase 75,000 shares of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock, having an exercise price of $3.70 per share, exercisable&#13;over a ten-year term. The options will vest in three equal installments beginning of January 4, 2022 and continuing on each of the two&#13;anniversaries thereafter until fully vested.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-weight: normal&gt;&lt;u&gt;Basis of Accounting&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;u&gt;Reclassifications&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;u&gt;Segment Reporting&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.15in; text-align: justify; text-indent: -0.15in&gt;&lt;font style=font-weight: normal&gt;&lt;u&gt;Use&#13;of Estimates&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;u&gt;Environmental Liabilities&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0&gt;&lt;u&gt;Cash and Cash Equivalents&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0&gt;&lt;u&gt;Cash in Excess of FDIC Insured Limits&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;u&gt;Fair Value of Financial Instruments&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;u&gt;Property&#13;and Equipment&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Property&#13;and equipment are stated at the lower of cost or estimated net recoverable amount. The cost of property, plant and equipment is depreciated&#13;using the straight-line method based on the lesser of the estimated useful lives of the assets or the lease term based on the following&#13;life expectancy:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 align=center style=width: 80%; border-collapse: collapse; font-size: 10pt&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style=vertical-align: top&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 38%; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Software&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 42%; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;3 years, or over&#13;    the life of the agreement&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style=vertical-align: top; background-color: #CCFFCC&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Office equipment&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;5 years&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style=vertical-align: top&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Furniture and fixtures&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;5 years&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style=vertical-align: top; background-color: #CCFFCC&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Machinery and equipment&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;7-10 years&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style=vertical-align: top&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Intangible assets&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Indefinite&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style=vertical-align: top; background-color: #CCFFCC&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Leasehold improvements&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Fully extended lease-term&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.15in; text-align: justify; text-indent: -0.15in&gt;&lt;font style=font-weight: normal&gt;&lt;u&gt;Impairment&#13;of Long-Lived Assets&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;Long-lived assets held and used by the Company&#13;are reviewed for possible impairment whenever events or circumstances indicate the carrying amount of an asset may not be recoverable&#13;or is impaired. Recoverability is assessed using undiscounted cash flows based upon historical results and current projections of earnings&#13;before interest and taxes. Impairment is measured using discounted cash flows of future operating results based upon a rate that corresponds&#13;to the cost of capital. Impairments are recognized in operating results to the extent that carrying value exceeds discounted cash flows&#13;of future operations.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;u&gt;Inventory&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Inventory,&#13;consisting of raw materials, material overhead, labor, and manufacturing overhead, are stated at the lower of cost (first-in, first-out)&#13;or net realizable value and consist of the following:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Times

 Serif&gt;&amp;#8211;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;u&gt;Goodwill&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0&gt;&lt;u&gt;Revenue Recognition&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0&gt;&lt;u&gt;Revenue Concentration&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;u&gt;Basic&#13;and Diluted Earnings (Loss) Per Share&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Basic&#13;earnings (loss) per share (&amp;#8220;EPS&amp;#8221;) are computed by dividing net income (the numerator) by the weighted average number of common&#13;shares outstanding for the period (the denominator). Diluted EPS is computed by dividing net income by the weighted average number of&#13;common shares and potential common shares outstanding (if dilutive) during each period. Potential common shares include stock options,&#13;warrants and restricted stock. The number of potential common shares outstanding relating to stock options, warrants and restricted stock&#13;is computed using the treasury stock method.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The&#13;reconciliation of the denominators used to calculate basic EPS and diluted EPS for the years ended December&amp;#160;31,&amp;#160;2020 and 2019&#13;are as follows:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=border-collapse: collapse; width: 100%&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times

 Serif&gt;862&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: rgb(204
255
204)&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Weighted&#13;    average common shares outstanding &amp;#8211; diluted&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 2.5pt double; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 2.5pt double; font-size: 10pt; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;1,886,951&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 2.5pt double; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 2.5pt double; font-size: 10pt; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;1,600,417&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;/table&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify; background-color: white&gt;&lt;u&gt;Stock-Based Compensation&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0&gt;&lt;u&gt;Income Taxes&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;The Company recognizes deferred tax assets and&#13;liabilities based on differences between the financial reporting and tax basis of assets and liabilities using the enacted tax rates and&#13;laws that are expected to be in effect when the differences are expected to be recovered. The Company provides a valuation allowance for&#13;deferred tax assets for which it does not consider realization of such assets to be more likely than not.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0&gt;&lt;u&gt;Uncertain Tax Positions&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;In accordance with ASC 740, &amp;#8220;Income Taxes&amp;#8221;&#13;(&amp;#8220;ASC 740&amp;#8221;), the Company recognizes the tax benefit from an uncertain tax position only if it is more likely than not that&#13;the tax position will be capable of withstanding examination by the taxing authorities based on the technical merits of the position.&#13;These standards prescribe a recognition threshold and measurement attribute for the financial statement recognition and measurement of&#13;a tax position taken or expected to be taken in a tax return. These standards also provide guidance on de-recognition, classification,&#13;interest and penalties, accounting in interim periods, disclosure, and transition.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;Various taxing authorities can periodically audit&#13;the Company&amp;#8217;s income tax returns. These audits include questions regarding the Company&amp;#8217;s tax filing positions, including the&#13;timing and amount of deductions and the allocation of income to various tax jurisdictions. In evaluating the exposures connected with&#13;these various tax filing positions, including state and local taxes, the Company records allowances for probable exposures. A number of&#13;years may elapse before a particular matter, for which an allowance has been established, is audited and fully resolved. The Company has&#13;not yet undergone an examination by any taxing authorities.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;u&gt;Recent Accounting Pronouncements&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify; background-color: white&gt;From time to time, new&#13;accounting pronouncements are issued by the Financial Accounting Standards Board (&amp;#34;FASB&amp;#34;) that are adopted by the Company as&#13;of the specified effective date. If not discussed, management believes that the impact of recently issued standards, which are not yet&#13;effective, will not have a material impact on the Company's financial statements upon adoption.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; background-color: white&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The&#13;cost of property, plant and equipment is depreciated using the straight-line method based on the lesser of the estimated useful lives&#13;of the assets or the lease term based on the following life expectancy:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times

 Times
 Serif&gt;Software&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 42%; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times

 Serif&gt;The&#13;following schedule summarizes the valuation of financial instruments at fair value on a recurring basis in the balances sheet as of December&amp;#160;31,2020&#13;and 2019:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;On&#13;    June 16, 2020, the Company entered into a loan authorization and loan agreement with the United States Small Business Administration&#13;    (the &amp;#8220;SBA&amp;#8221;), as lender, pursuant to the SBA&amp;#8217;s Economic Injury Disaster Loan (&amp;#8220;EIDL&amp;#8221;) assistance program&#13;    in light of the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on the Company&amp;#8217;s business (the &amp;#8220;EIDL Loan Agreement&amp;#8221;) encompassing&#13;    a $150,000 Promissory Note issued to the SBA (the &amp;#8220;EIDL Note&amp;#8221;)(together with the EIDL Loan Agreement, the &amp;#8220;EIDL&#13;    Loan&amp;#8221;), bearing interest at 3.75% per annum. In connection with entering into the EIDL Loan, the Company also executed a security&#13;    agreement, dated June 16, 2020, between the SBA and the Company (the &amp;#8220;EIDL Security Agreement&amp;#8221;) pursuant to which the&#13;    EIDL Loan is secured by a security interest on all of the Company&amp;#8217;s assets. Under the EIDL Note, the Company is required to&#13;    pay principal and interest payments of $731 every month beginning June 16, 2021. All remaining principal and accrued interest is&#13;    due and payable on June 16, 2050. The EIDL Note may be repaid at any time without penalty.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width: 2%; font-size: 10pt&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 1%; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width: 8%; font-size: 10pt; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;150,000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width: 1%; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width: 2%; font-size: 10pt&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 1%; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width: 8%; font-size: 10pt; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#8211;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width: 1%; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: White&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: rgb(204
255
204)&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;On&#13;    April 24, 2020, the Company entered into a loan agreement with Kensington Bank (&amp;#8220;Kensington&amp;#8221;), as lender (the &amp;#8220;Loan&#13;    Agreement&amp;#8221;) encompassing a $112,925 Promissory Note issued to Kensington (the &amp;#8220;PPP Note&amp;#8221;) pursuant to Payroll Protection&#13;    Program established as part of the Coronavirus Aid, Relief, and Economic Security Act (the &amp;#8220;CARES Act&amp;#8221;), which provides&#13;    loans to qualifying businesses and is administered by the U.S. Small Business Administration (the &amp;#8220;SBA&amp;#8221;). The PPP Note&#13;    bears interest at 1.00% per annum, with interest payable monthly beginning November 24, 2020, and principal due in full on April&#13;    24, 2022. The PPP Note may be repaid at any time without penalty. Under the Payroll Protection Program, the Company will be eligible&#13;    for loan forgiveness up to the full amount of the PPP Note and any accrued interest. The forgiveness amount will be equal to the&#13;    amount that the Company spends during the 24-week period beginning April 24, 2020 on payroll costs, payment of rent on any leases&#13;    in force prior to February 15, 2020 and payment on any utility for which service began before February 15, 2020. The maximum amount&#13;    of loan forgiveness for non-payroll expenses is 40% of the amount of the PPP Note. On January&amp;#160;19, 2021, the Company received&#13;    forgiveness, as authorized by Section 1106 of the Cares Act in the amount of $113,772, consisting of $112,925 of principal and $847&#13;    of interest.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;112,925&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: rgb(204
255
204)&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;On November&#13;    25, 2019, the Company entered into a credit account agreement (&amp;#8220;Margin Account&amp;#8221;) with RBC Capital Markets, LLC (&amp;#8220;RBC&amp;#8221;).&#13;    The Margin Account enables the Company to borrow against the Company&amp;#8217;s AESE shares that are held in an account with RBC. The&#13;    advances received on margin bear interest at rates of between 1.00% and 2.75% over the Base Lending Rate, depending on the average&#13;    outstanding debit balance. The Base Lending Rate is internally determined by RBC using Broker Call, Prime Rate as determined by commercial&#13;    banks utilized by RBC CM, Fed Funds, RBC CM&amp;#8217;s cost of funds, and other commercially recognized rates of interest. The margin&#13;    loans are collateralized by the underlying AESE shares. A total of $122,100 was borrowed on the Margin Account over various dates&#13;    between January 29, 2020 and March 6, 2020. The outstanding balance was repaid in full on, or about, March 12, 2020 out of the proceeds&#13;    of the loan from Cadence Bank, described below.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#8211;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#8211;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: White&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: rgb(204
255
204)&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; padding-bottom: 1pt&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;On&#13;    March 12, 2020, the Company entered into a business loan agreement with Cadence&amp;#160;Bank, N.A. (&amp;#8220;Cadence&amp;#8221;), as lender&#13;    encompassing a $700,000 Promissory Note issued to&amp;#160;Cadence (the &amp;#8220;Note&amp;#8221;), a Security Agreement by the Company in favor&#13;    of&amp;#160;Cadence and limited commercial guarantees by the Company&amp;#8217;s Chief Executive Officer and Interim Chief Financial Officer,&#13;    who is one in the same, and members of the Company&amp;#8217;s Board of Directors (the &amp;#8220;Guarantors&amp;#8221;) (collectively, the &amp;#8220;Cadence&#13;    Loan&amp;#8221;). The Note carried interest at a rate of 0.50 percentage points over the prime rate, as published in the Wall Street&#13;    Journal, payable monthly, and was due on March 9, 2021. The Note could be repaid at any time without penalty. The Note was secured&#13;    by all of the Company&amp;#8217;s rights, title and interests in and to 500,000 shares of the common stock of Allied Esports Entertainment&#13;    Inc. (NASDAQ: AESE) currently owned by the Company and held in the Company&amp;#8217;s brokerage account with&amp;#160;RBC&amp;#160;Capital Markets,&#13;    LLC. On March 26, 2020, the Company subsequently entered into a separate letter agreement with the Guarantors (the &amp;#8220;Letter&#13;    Agreement&amp;#8221;), which provides that if the Company defaults or fails to make any payment due under the Cadence Loan and the Guarantors&#13;    are required to make payment to Cadence pursuant to the Guarantees, then the Company agrees to issue additional equity interests&#13;    or rights to Guarantors reflecting ninety-five percent (95%) of the outstanding equity of the Company at the time of such default&#13;    to participating Guarantors who have made the payments to Cadence. All equity issuances will be subject to any third party or shareholder&#13;    approvals required at the time of issuance. A total of $417,000 was advanced on the loan and subsequently repaid in full on June&#13;    30, 2020.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=font-size: 10pt; padding-bottom: 1pt&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times

&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Note&#13;17 &amp;#8211; Commitments&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The&#13;Company is involved in various inquiries, administrative proceedings and litigation relating to matters arising in the normal course&#13;of business. The Company is not currently a defendant in any material litigation and is not aware of any threatened litigation that could&#13;have a material effect on the Company. Management is not able to estimate the minimum loss to be incurred, if any, as a result of the&#13;final outcome of the matters arising in the normal course of business but believes they are not likely to have a material adverse effect&#13;upon the Company&amp;#8217;s financial position or results of operations and, accordingly, no provision for loss has been recorded.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The&#13;Company periodically maintains cash balances at banks in excess of federally insured amounts. The extent of loss, if any, to be sustained&#13;as a result of any future failure of a bank or other financial institution is not subject to estimation at this time.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Upon&#13;closing of the Asset Purchase Agreement, the Company assumed the Seller&amp;#8217;s obligations under a real property lease for its 20,945&#13;square foot facility in Irving, Texas, under which an entity owned entirely by Ira Goldfarb is the landlord. The lease term is through&#13;September 15, 2025, with two five-year options to extend, at a monthly lease term of $10,036, with approximately a 3% annual escalation&#13;of lease payments commencing September 15, 2021.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The&#13;future minimum lease payments due under operating leases as of December 31&lt;font style=color: black&gt;, 2020 is as follows:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
